intro: Sasamorpha qingyuanensis, commonly known as the Qingyuan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions and prefers well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
